info.description: Definition of an operation or a named query
info.title: FHIR R4 OperationDefinition Resource

OperationDefinition.description: Definition of an operation or a named query

affectsState.description: Whether content is changed by the operation

base.description: Marks this as a profile of the base

code.description: Name used to invoke the operation

description.description: Natural language description of the operation definition

experimental.description: For testing purposes, not real usage

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

jurisdiction.description: Intended jurisdiction for operation definition (if applicable)

name.description: Name for this operation definition (computer friendly)

overload.description: Define overloaded variants for when  generating code

publisher.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)

purpose.description: Why this operation definition is defined

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

title.description: Name for this operation definition (human friendly)

url.description: Canonical identifier for this operation definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)

useContext.description: The context that the content is intended to support

version.description: Business version of the operation definition

parameterName.description: Name of parameter to include in overload

binding.description: ValueSet details if this is coded

name.description: Name in Parameters.parameter.name or in URL

searchType.description: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri | special

targetProfile.description: If type is Reference | canonical, allowed targets

name.description: Name of an individual to contact

telecom.description: Contact details for individual or organization

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

url.description: identifies the meaning of the extension

coding.description: Code defined by a terminology system

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

lastUpdated.description: When the resource version last changed

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

period.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use

rank.description: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)

system.description: phone | fax | email | pager | url | sms | other

use.description: home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point

country.description: Country (e.g. can be ISO 3166 2 or 3 letter code)

line.description: Street name, number, direction & P.O. Box etc.

period.description: Time period when address was/is in use

use.description: home | work | temp | old | billing - purpose of this address

contentType.description: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.

size.description: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)

title.description: Label to display in place of the data

url.description: Uri where the data can be found

mustSupport.description: Indicates specific structure elements that are referenced by the knowledge module

profile.description: The profile of the required data

type.description: The type of the required data

description.description: Natural language description of the condition

name.description: Short name assigned to expression for reuse

given.description: Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names

period.description: Time period when name was/is in use

prefix.description: Parts that come before the name

suffix.description: Parts that come after the name

text.description: Text representation of the full name

use.description: usual | official | temp | nickname | anonymous | old | maiden

assigner.description: Organization that issued id (may be just text)

period.description: Time period when id is/was valid for use

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

use.description: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)

documentation.description: A brief description of the parameter

name.description: Name used to access the parameter value

profile.description: What profile the value is expected to be

system.description: System that defines coded unit form

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

display.description: Brief description of the related artifact

type.description: documentation | justification | citation | predecessor | successor | derived-from | depends-on | composed-of

url.description: Where the artifact can be accessed

dimensions.description: Number of sample points at each time point

factor.description: Multiply data by this before adding to origin

data.description: The actual signature content (XML DigSig. JWS, picture, etc.)

sigFormat.description: The technical format of the signature

targetFormat.description: The technical format of the signed resources

type.description: Indication of the reason the entity signed the object(s)

name.description: Name or URI that identifies the event

type.description: named-event | periodic | data-changed | data-added | data-modified | data-removed | data-accessed | data-access-ended

path.description: A code-valued attribute to filter on

searchParam.description: A coded (token) parameter to search on

path.description: A date-valued attribute to filter on

searchParam.description: A date valued parameter to search on

path.description: The name of the attribute to perform the sort

type.description: The kind of dose or rate specified

countMax.description: Maximum number of times to repeat

dayOfWeek.description: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun

durationUnit.description: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)

frequency.description: Event occurs frequency times per period

frequencyMax.description: Event occurs up to frequencyMax times per period

period.description: Event occurs frequency times per period

periodUnit.description: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)

when.description: Code for time period of occurrence

text.div:
Generated Narrative with Details

id: example

url: http://h7.org/fhir/OperationDefinition/example

version: B

name: Populate Questionnaire

status: draft

kind: operation

date: 04/08/2015

publisher: Acme Healthcare Services

contact:

description: Limited implementation of the Populate Questionnaire implementation

useContext:

jurisdiction: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (the) (Details : {urn:iso:std:iso:3166 code 'GB' = 'United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland', given as 'United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (the)'})

code: populate

comment: Only implemented for Labs and Medications so far

base: OperationDefinition/Questionnaire-populate

resource: Questionnaire

system: false

type: false

instance: true

parameter

name: subject

use: in

min: 1

max: 1

documentation: The resource that is to be the *QuestionnaireResponse.subject*. The [[[QuestionnaireResponse]]] instance will reference the provided subject. In addition, if the *local* parameter is set to true, server information about the specified subject will be used to populate the instance.

type: Reference

parameter

name: local

use: in

min: 0

max: 1

documentation: If the *local* parameter is set to true, server information about the specified subject will be used to populate the instance.

type: Reference

parameter

name: return

use: out

min: 1

max: 1

documentation: The partially (or fully)-populated set of answers for the specified Questionnaire

type: QuestionnaireResponse

overload

parameterName: subject, local

overload

parameterName: subject

comment: local defaults to false when not passed as a parameter

value.name: Populate Questionnaire
value.description: Limited implementation of the Populate Questionnaire implementation

coding.display: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (the)

value.comment: Only implemented for Labs and Medications so far

parameter.name: subject
parameter.documentation: The resource that is to be the *QuestionnaireResponse.subject*. The [[[QuestionnaireResponse]]]      instance will reference the provided subject.  In addition, if the *local* parameter is      set to true, server information about the specified subject will be used to populate the      instance.

parameter.name: local
parameter.documentation: If the *local* parameter is set to true, server information about the specified subject will be used to populate the instance.

parameter.name: return
parameter.documentation: The partially (or fully)-populated set of answers for the specified Questionnaire

overload.comment: local defaults to false when not passed as a parameter

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Marks this as a profile of the base

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A use context assigned to the activity definition

parameters.name: context-quantity
parameters.description: A quantity- or range-valued use context assigned to the activity definition

parameters.name: context-type
parameters.description: A type of use context assigned to the activity definition

parameters.name: context-type-quantity
parameters.description: A use context type and quantity- or range-based value assigned to the activity definition

parameters.name: context-type-value
parameters.description: A use context type and value assigned to the activity definition

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The activity definition publication date

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the activity definition

parameters.name: input-profile
parameters.description: Validation information for in parameters

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: SOP Instance UID for an instance

parameters.name: jurisdiction
parameters.description: Intended jurisdiction for the activity definition

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: codesystem | identifier | root

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Human-readable label

parameters.name: output-profile
parameters.description: Validation information for out parameters

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Name of the publisher of the activity definition

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: active | inactive | entered-in-error | on-hold | unknown

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: The system for any codes defined by this code system (same as 'url')

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The human-friendly name of the activity definition

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: E.g. patient, expense, depreciation

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The uri that identifies the activity definition

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The business version of the activity definition
